alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pendleton; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 11:49AM EST until November 16 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Wintry mix expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations ranging from around a coating to 2 inches. Total ice accumulations ranging from a trace to a tenth of an inch below 2000 feet with a tenth up to a quarter inch above 2000 feet. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland and Eastern Highland Counties. In West Virginia, Western Pendleton and Eastern Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. A wintry mix will change to mainly freezing rain late this afternoon before mixing with rain and ending later tonight. Light snow is possible behind this system along and west of the Allegheny Front late tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will be reduced to under 1 mile at times in a wintry mix as well as fog.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
